If the creature is immune to psychic damage, it is unaffected by this feature. On a failed save, you are now completely in control of that creature’s body for 1 hour, temporarily leaving your own body. You gain the creature's physical ability scores but maintain your mental ability scores. On a successful save, nothing happens. While in control of this creature's body, your body lies unconscious and you can not feel or perceive anything that happens to your body. If your body dies while using this feature, you lose control of the creature’s mind. After using this feature, you must finish a long rest before you regain use of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Tangible Projections
entries: At 18th level, you have learned the secret of weaving tangible magic into your illusions to give them a temporary reality. When you cast an Illusion spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose one inanimate, non-magical object that is part of the illusion and make that object real. You can do this on your turn as a bonus action while the spell is ongoing. The object remains real for 1 minute. For example, you can create an illusion of a door on the wall of a jail cell and make it real long enough for you to step through. You can attempt to make an Illusory creature real but it must be of CR 5 or lower. If you choose illusory reality to create a creature, you may not use it again this way until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shield
entries: At 2nd level, your studies have revealed to you how to to use your arcane energy to protect you and those around you. When you cast a Divination or Abjuration spell you may imbue one ally with minor protective magic. Choose yourself or one ally within 50 feet of you, they gain an AC bonus equal to ½ of the level (rounded up) of Divination or Abjuration spell you casted until the start of your next turn. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and all uses of this feature are restored when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Intervention
entries: At 6th level, you can see glimpses into the future. These glimpses allow you to concentrate your magical energy to give some ability to change the future. Whenever you or a creature within 100 feet of you makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to store that roll and make them reroll. You can then use another reaction to use the stored roll to replace any ability check, attack roll or saving throw. If you do not use the stored roll before you finish a long rest you lose it. Once you use this feature you can not use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Metamagic: Enhanced Concentration
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to use your magic to enhance your concentration and make it so you can concentrate multiple spells of your specialized schools of magic at once. When you cast a spell on your turn and you are already concentrating on a spell you may expend 3 Magi Points to cast another spell that is either Abjuration or Divination that requires concentration. When making concentration checks for these spells, you make each concentration check separately.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Intervention
entries: At 14th level, your glimpses into the future have grown strong enough that you can change events more frequently. You can use your 'Intervention' feature twice before finishing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Resistance
entries: At 18th level, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and spell effects. Additionally, you have resistance against the damage of spells and spell effects.

subclassFeature.name: Success Revoked
entries: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to cause an enemy to fail when they should have succeeded. When an enemy succeeds a saving throw against a Transmutation or Necromancy spell you casted, you may instead use your reaction to make them reroll the saving throw (they must use the new roll). Once you use this feature, you may not use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Phylactery
entries: At 6th level, your work has brought you to the creation of a phylactery, an ancient form of magic that you believe will give you insight into the vast mysteries of life. You can spend 8 hours creating a phylactery that contains vast magic that you can only tap the surface of. You gain one of the following benefits that you can change at the end of every long rest:

items: Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
An increase to speed of 10 feet while you are unencumbered.
Proficiency in Constitution saving throws.
Resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or thunder damage (your choice whenever you choose this benefit).

entries: Additionally, Undead creatures you summon gain hit points equal to your Magus level and deal additional damage on their attacks equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Metamagic: Chronoshift
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to manipulate the time it would normally take to cast one of your spells from your specialized schools of magic. When you cast a Necromancy or Transmutation spell that has a casting time of 1 hour or less, you can choose to expend 3 Magi Points to change its casting time to 1 action.

subclassFeature.name: Flesh from Earth
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to transmute humanoid bodies. As an action, you can transform from 100 pounds to 300 pounds of wood, dirt, stone, iron, copper, or material into a humanoid body or skeleton, and you can also do the reverse. You can turn a creature within 5 feet of you into either wood, dirt, stone, iron, copper, or silver; when attempting this on a creature that is still living, that creature makes a Constitution saving throw (DC = your Magi Spell Save DC). On a failed save, they take 7d8 of force damage, the creature takes half as much on a successful save. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this feature, they turn into the material you choose when you initiated this feature.
This feature has no effect on undead and constructs. You can use this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and you regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Phylactery
entries: At 18th level, you have now studied your phylactery further and have uncovered more of its many mysterious properties. Your phylactery can give you:

items: Resistance to necrotic damage (if you choose necrotic damage as your resistance as your benefit through the phylactery you instead gain immunity to necrotic damage), or poison damage.
An increase to speed of 10 feet while you are unencumbered.Advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and immunity to disease.

entries: Additionally, when you cast Animate Dead or Create Undead, you can target one additional corpse or pile of bones, creating another zombie, skeleton, or ghoul as appropriate.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: At 2nd level, you pick one damage type from acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Spells you cast ignore resistance to the damage of the chosen type (including attacks by creatures summoned by spells you cast).

subclassFeature.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: At 6th level, your damaging cantrips become more effective at damaging foes. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against a cantrip you casted, the creature takes ½ the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip. Additionally, if the cantrip is casted as a spell attack you may add your Intelligence modifier to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Metamagic: Energy Change
entries: At 10th level, you have gained the ability to change the damage type that a spell from your specialized school of magic inflicts. When you cast a spell that is either Conjuration or Evocation that inflicts damage, you may expend 3 Magi Points to change that spell's damage type to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Aura
entries: At 14th level, you have learned how to make the creatures you summon, along with yourself, radiate your favored element. At the end of your turn, you and any creatures you summon deal 5 damage of the type you chose at 2nd level with 'Elemental Affinity' to any creature within 5 feet of you or any creature you summon. An enemy can not take more than 20 damage per round from this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Master
entries: At 18th level, you have now mastered the element you chose at 2nd level as part of your 'Elemental Affinity'. You now ignore immunities and gain resistance to the damage type you chose with 'Elemental Affinity'.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: At 3rd level, you augment your natural prowess with the ability to cast spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Magus spell list. You learn an additional Magus cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Arcana Seeker Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest. For example, if you know the 1st level spell shield and have a 1st level and a 2nd level spell slot available, you can cast shield using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-level and higher
entries: You know three 1st level Magus spells of your choice. The Spells Known column of the Arcane Seeker Spellcasting table shows when you learn more Magus spells of 1st level or higher. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the Magus spells you know with another spell of your choice from the Magus spell list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Arcana Seeker spells, since you learn your spells through study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an Arcana Seeker spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Sniper
entries: At 3rd level, when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can spend one Arcana Seeker spell slot to deal force damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The additional damage is 2d6 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d6 for each spell level higher than 1st.

subclassFeature.name: Explorer of Arcana
entries: At 7th level, your search for arcane treasures and secrets has led you to gain an uncanny knack in identifying things of an arcane nature as well as finding the spots in which they hide. If you are not already proficient in the Arcana skill or the Investigation skill you gain proficiency with those skills, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability checks you make with the Arcana and Investigation skills.

subclassFeature.name: Use Magic Device
entries: At 11th level, you have learned enough about the workings of magic that you can improvise the use of items even when they are not intended for you. You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Emulation
entries: At 15th level, you gain the ability to magically steal the knowledge of how to cast a spell from another spellcaster. Immediately after a creature casts a spell that targets you or includes you in its area of effect, you can use your reaction to make an Intelligence (Arcana) check. The DC of the check is equal to the (Spells saving throw DC + the Spell Level) or (the Spell Attack roll + the Spell Level), depending on the type of spell casted. If you succeed the ability check, you can use this spell once without having to expend a spell slot (it does not need to be a Magus spell). The spell is cast at the same level it was originally casted at. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier and you regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: A Hunter’s Mark
entries: At 3rd level, you can pick out a creature's weak points and you begin to pick up at where you can hit a creature to deal extra damage. You can cast the Hunter’s Mark spell a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You do not have to provide any of the components to cast these spells. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Prey
entries: At 3rd level, you gain one of the following features of your choice:

entries.name: Colossus Slayer
entries: Your tenacity can wear down the most potent foes. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the creature takes an extra 1d8 damage if it is below its hit point maximum. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn.

entries.name: Giant Killer
entries: When a Large or larger creature within 5 feet of you hits or misses you with an attack, you can use your reaction to attack that creature immediately after its attack, provided that you can see the creature.

entries.name: Horde Breaker
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make a weapon attack, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of your weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Tactics
entries: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice:

entries.name: Escape the Horde
entries: Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Multiattack Defense
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack, you gain a +4 bonus to AC against all subsequent attacks made by that creature for the rest of the turn.

entries.name: Steel Will
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Torrent
entries: At 11th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice:

entries.name: Volley
entries: You can use your action to make a ranged attack against any number of creatures within 10 feet of a point you can see within your weapon's range. You must have ammo for each target, as normal, and you make a separate attack roll for each target. If you are using a firearm you can not use any of your attacks that you have using this feature to reload your weapon.

entries.name: Whirlwind Attack
entries: You can use your action to make a melee attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll for each target.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Hunter's Defense
entries: At 15th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice:

entries.name: Evasion
entries: You can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

entries.name: Stand Against the Tide
entries: When a hostile creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force that creature to repeat the same attack against another creature (other than itself) of your choice.

entries.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

subclassFeature.name: Maverick's Companions
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to fully tame beast companions that will train and listen to your commands fully

To tame a companion it must be a beast. You must make a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. If you do not have proficiency with the Animal Handling ability, you gain proficiency with it. The DC for the ability check is equal to the beasts’ Constitution score + their CR (rounded up). If you succeed your ability check, you must spend at least 24 hours within the next 7 days with the beast before it becomes your companion. You can tame multiple companion beasts at one time. However, the total CR of beasts you can tame at once must be less than or equal to ¼ of your Maverick class levels. Your companions obey your commands as best as they can. They take their turns on your initiative, though they do not take any actions unless you command them to. On your turn, you can verbally command all of your Companions where to move (no action required by you). You can use your action to verbally command them to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, or Help action. While traveling through your favored terrain with only your companions, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Assault
entries: At 7th level, your Companions can add your Proficiency bonus to their attack rolls. Additionally, your Companions’ attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunities.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Taming
entries: At 11th level, you have perfected the regiment you use to train your Companions and they have grown stronger as a result. You can add your Wisdom modifier to your Companions’ AC and Damage Rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Absolute Coordination
entries: At 15th level, you and your Companions have become so intune with each other that your coordination in battle has become much more effective. Instead of using your action to command your Companions, you can use your bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Fast Hands
entries: At 3rd level, you can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your thieves’ tools to disarm a trap or open a lock, or take the Use an Object action.

subclassFeature.name: Second-Story Work
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs you extra movement. In addition, when you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Sneak
entries: At 9th level, you have advantage on a Dexterity (Stealth) check if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ruthless
entries: At 13th level, you feel no compassion for your enemies, or if you do you do not show it. If you do not already have it you gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill and you are immune to being charmed. Along with this, you have learned to spare no one, not even the defenseless. When you make attack an incapacitated target double the sneak attack dice you use for your damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Thief's Reflexes
entries: At 17th level, you have become adept at laying ambushes and quickly escaping danger. You can take two turns during the first round of any combat. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at your initiative minus 10. You can not use this feature when you are surprised.

subclassFeature.name: Professional Practices
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with two of the following tool sets: disguise kit, forgery kit, or poisoner’s kit.

subclassFeature.name: Collecting Aces
entries: At 3rd level, your experience with bounties and deals has netted you with the ability to collect critical information about your targets. Spending 1 hour studying a target grants you one “Ace.” An Ace is a potential vulnerability of your target which you have taken note of. You can collect a maximum of three Aces on a single target and you can have up to two targets at a time. Any Aces you collect from a third target causes you to lose all Aces on your first target. When making an attack roll against a target which you have collected Aces for, you can spend an Ace to grant yourself advantage on the attack roll (the Ace you spend must have been collected from the target of your attack). You gain additional uses for Aces at 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Innovating Intelligence
entries: At 9th level, you can use Aces to do more than exploit the combative vulnerabilities of your targets. When using a disguise kit for the purposes of deceiving or emulating your target, you can spend an Ace to gain advantage on your ability check made in relation to the disguise kit. When using a forgery kit for the purposes of deceiving or emulating your target, you can spend an Ace to gain advantage on your ability check made in relation to the forgery kit. When using a poisoner’s kit for the purposes of poisoning your target, you can spend an Ace to gain advantage on your ability check made in relation to the poisoner’s kit.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Aces
entries: At 13th level, your ability to gather, document, and comprehend the critical information that your target reveals has vastly improved. You can now collect a maximum of five Aces on one target and you can now have up to three targets at a time. Additionally, you now collect two Aces on your target per hour. You must still spend an entire hour studying your target to collect Aces for that hour. For example, if you had four Aces on a target, you would still need to spend an entire hour studying your target to reach your maximum of five Aces.

subclassFeature.name: Perfectly Executed
entries: At 17th level, your tendency for careful planning and rigorous research has granted you the ability to land that one perfect strike. When you successfully hit a target of whom you have collected Aces in a way which grants you Sneak Attack, you may spend a number of Aces (collected from that target) to add additional Sneak Attack dice equal to the amount of Aces spent (these dice are not doubled for critical hits).

subclassFeature.name: Gun Smuggler
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned how to conceal your weapons well enough that those that would want to take your weaponry (or even want to know whether you are carrying a weapon) have a hard time finding where you have hidden them. You have advantage on any Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks made to conceal firearms.

subclassFeature.name: Speed Loader
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned how to reload quickly so as not to hinder yourself in a gunfight. You can use your bonus action to reload a firearm.

subclassFeature.name: Pistolero
entries: At 9th level, you have learned how to take advantage of your ability with a pistol in order to give yourself an edge, even in less than favorable circumstances. As long as you are using a firearm that uses the pistol ammo type, you do not need advantage on your attack roll to use your Sneak Attack even if no ally is within 5 feet of the creature you are attacking, and even if you have disadvantage on the attack roll. All the other rules for the Sneak Attack class feature still apply to you.

subclassFeature.name: Risky Gambit
entries: At 13th level, you have learned how to make risky decisions that could pay off in spades, with the knowledge it may beset you soon enough. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw you can choose to make it with advantage. If you use this feature, the next ability check, attack roll, saving throw you make must be made with disadvantage. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and you regain all uses of this feature after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Horse
entries: At 18th level you have learned to pull yourself up when the odds are stacked against your favor in order to come out on top even in unlikely circumstances. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with disadvantage you may add your Charisma modifier to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Knife Juggler
entries: At 3rd level, you can use your bonus action to make a ranged dagger attack.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Instincts
entries: At 3rd level, your unmistakable confidence propels you into battle. You can add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls. In addition, you do not need advantage on your attack roll to use your Sneak Attack if no hostile creature other than your target is within 5 feet of you. All the other rules for the Sneak Attack class feature still apply to you.

subclassFeature.name: Strike of Panic
entries: At 9th level, when you make an attack with a dagger you can force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on its next attack roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (min. 1). You regain all uses of this feature after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Flurry of Blades
entries: At 13th level, when you are wielding your blades, your hands move in a flurry of motion. You can use your action to make either melee or ranged dagger attacks against all enemies within 15 feet of you. You must have a separate dagger for each ranged attack, and you make a separate attack roll for each target.

subclassFeature.name: Right Between the Eyes
entries: At 17th level, your deadliness and accuracy with a dagger has reached its peak. When you successfully make a dagger attack using the Knife Juggler feature the enemy must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). Roll a number of dice equal to half of your sneak attack dice pool (rounded down). On a failed saving throw the target takes sneak attack damage equal to the amount rolled, on a successful saving throw the target takes half that damage.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 2nd level, you gain proficiency with three artistic instruments of your choice and the Performance skill. You may also use instruments you are proficient in as a spell focus.

subclassFeature.name: Countercharm
entries: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to use musical notes or words of power to disrupt mind-influencing effects. As an action, you can start a performance that lasts until the end of your next turn. During that time, you and any friendly creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed. A creature must be able to hear or see you to gain this benefit. The performance ends early if you are incapacitated or silenced or if you voluntarily end it (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Cutting Words
entries: At 6th level, you learn how to use your wit to distract, confuse, and otherwise sap the confidence and competence of others. When a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, an ability check, a damage roll, or a saving throw you can use your reaction to expend one of your uses of Sagely Inspiration, roll a Sagely Inspiration die and subtract the number rolled from the creature's roll. You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the GM determines whether the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw succeeds or fails, or before the creature deals its damage. The creature is immune if it can not hear you or if it is immune to being charmed.

subclassFeature.name: Nature’s Melody
entries: At 10th level, you have learned how to draw on the essence of nature and the meaning of the world. As an action you can express this essence and when you do you can choose from cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder and you and a number of allies equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) gain a resistance to that damage type. When you or an ally make a damage roll, after making a successful weapon attack, you can add 1d6 of the chosen damage to the damage roll. Instead of choosing a damage type you could instead choose to have a number of allies equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) regain hit points equal to 1d6 plus your Charisma modifier at the end of your turn until the end of the duration of this feature. This feature lasts for a number of rounds equal to half of your Sage class levels and you must concentrate on this feature as if it were a spell. Creatures can not gain the benefits of this feature if they can not hear you, if they are immune to being charmed, or if they are a construct or undead. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Display of Heroism
entries: At 14th level, you have learned how to use your art to not only touch people’s minds but also to inspire their souls. As an action you can begin to express an anecdote of heroism that gives all allies within 60 feet advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. You must concentrate on this feature as if you were concentrating on a spell, and this feature can last a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you join the School of Combat at 2nd level, you gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, martial weapons, and firearms.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Inspiration
entries: At 2nd level, you learn to inspire others in battle. A creature that has a Sagely Inspiration die from you can roll that die and add the number rolled to a weapon damage roll when they successfully make a weapon attack. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the creature, it can use its reaction to roll the Sagely Inspiration die and add the number rolled to its AC against that attack, this feature can be used after the attack is declared but before knowing whether it hits or misses.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Instant Inspiration
entries: At 10th level, when a creature receives Sagely Inspiration it can use its reaction to immediately make one weapon attack against an enemy.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Magic
entries: At 14th level, you have mastered the art of weaving spellcasting and weapon use into a single act. When you use your action to cast a Sage spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: When you join the School of Duality at 2nd level, you can choose an additional cantrip from the Sage’s cantrip list and add it to your cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Dual Casting
entries: At 2nd level, when you cast a cantrip that normally targets only one creature, the spell can instead target two creatures within range and within 5 feet of each other, if the cantrip has a range of touch both targets must be within touch range of you.

subclassFeature.name: Perceptual Burst
entries: At 6th level, you learn how to unleash the latent magical energy residing in yourself that can be a boon for allies but the bane of your enemies. As an action you can unleash this energy, all allies within 30 feet regain hit points equal to your Sage class levels + your Wisdom modifier and all enemies within 30 feet must make a Constitution saving throw against your Sage spell save DC, on a failure they take damage equal to two times your Sage level, half as much on a success. You can not use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mind and Body
entries: At 10th level, you have learned how to operate matters of mind and body so that they do not interfere as heavily with each other. You gain resistance to psychic damage and you now have advantage on all concentration checks.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Dual Casting
entries: At 14th level, when you cast a Sage spell of 1st through 5th level that targets only one creature, the spell can instead target two creatures within range and within 5 feet of each other, if the spell has a range of touch it both targets must be within touch range of you. If the spell consumes its material components, you must provide the material components for each target.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you join the School of thought at 2nd level, you learn a language of your choice. You also become proficient in your choice of two of the following skills: Animal Handling, Arcana, History, Insight, Investigation, Mechanics, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Religion, or Survival.

subclassFeature.name: Thorough Logic
entries: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to further your logical pursuits by using your wisdom. When you make an ability check with a skill that you are proficient in and that uses your Intelligence ability modifier you may also add your Wisdom ability modifier to the ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Magical Secrets
entries: At 6th level, you learn two spells of your choice from any class. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Sage table, or a cantrip. The chosen spells count as Sage spells for you but do not count against the number of Sage spells you have prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: At 10th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any Sage cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Rational Spells
entries: At 14th level, you have learned to use not only your Wisdom in spellcasting but also your Intelligence. When you cast a Sage spell that you know, you can add your Intelligence modifier in addition to any place you would use your normal spellcasting ability. This includes when determining Spell Save DCs, spell attack modifiers and spell damage.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Magic
entries: At 1st level, you have learned to use your own life energy to tap into magic that you possess. You can cast a spell that is 5th level or lower that you have prepared without expending a spell slot by expending an amount of hit points equal to 5 times the spell’s level that you are casting. You can also cast spells at higher levels using this feature, to do so you expend a number of hit points for the spell you are casting equivalent to what you would expend on a normal spell of that higher level. Any spells that allow you to regain hit points using this feature can not be used on yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Warding
entries: At 6th level, the animistic spirits which are drawn to you provide protection to you and your allies. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to damage from spells.

subclassFeature.name: Twilight State
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to put creatures or yourself into a state of existence that would make the target unable to interact with the world around you. You can use this feature on yourself or a creature within touch range and it acts as if you casted the Etherealness spell with the following exceptions: the plane they have been put in is the Twilight Plane, a coalition of deep darkness or blinding light. Targets can only perceive the material plane while in this plane by making a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) Ability check, the target is stuck in the place in which they were transported to the Twilight Plane and can not move from that spot. You can only dispel Twilight State early if you have used the feature on yourself, which takes an action. If you attempt to use this feature on an unwilling creature they can make a Charisma saving throw against your Shaman Spell Save DC. On a success they are not affected by Twilight State. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Spirit
entries: At 18th level, through channeling powerful spiritual energies you can assume the form of an ancient force of nature, taking on an appearance you choose. For example, your skin might turn green or take on a bark-like texture, your hair might become leafy or moss-like, or you might sprout antlers or a lion-like mane. Using your action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You and friendly creatures within 30 feet of you can not be charmed or frightened while you are in this form
All allies within 30 feet you regain 5 hit points per turn
Enemies within 60 feet of you have disadvantage on all saving throws made against your Shaman spells that you cast

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Path
entries: At 1st level, you choose a totem animal from bear, eagle, and wolf, the totem animal you choose will affect the benefits you get at this level as well as affect benefits you gain from abilities at later levels.

entries.name: Bear
entries: You immediately gain 2 hit points and you gain an additional 2 hit points whenever you gain an additional level in the Shaman class.

entries.name: Eagle
entries: You gain flying speed equal to your current walking speed. This benefit works only in short bursts; you fall if you end your turn in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft

entries.name: Wolf
entries: You gain proficiency with Constitution saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Animalistic Ferocity
entries: At 11th level, you have learned how to channel your animalistic nature to give you an edge on the battlefield. On your turn you can channel your totem animal as a bonus action to gain benefits based on your spirit animal for 1 minute.You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, you regain all uses of this feature after a long rest.

entries.name: Bear
entries: You gain resistance to all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

entries.name: Eagle
entries: Once per turn you may Disengage as a free action and you may Dash as a bonus action

entries.name: Wolf
entries: You and all allies within 5 feet of you gain advantage on all attack rolls

subclassFeature.name: Primal Power
entries: At 18th level, you can feel the primal power of your totem animal flowing through your veins and it allows you to push past humanoid limitations based upon your totem animal.

entries.name: Bear
entries: Your Strength ability score maximum is now 24 and you gain +4 to your Strength score

entries.name: Eagle
entries: Your Dexterity ability score maximum is now 24 and you gain +4 to your Dexterity score

entries.name: Wolf
entries: Your Constitution ability score maximum is now 24 and you gain +4 to your Constitution score.

subclassFeature.name: Potions
entries: At 2nd level, you learn how to craft potions that contain the ingredients to distill your magic. The potions you craft only contain the basic ingredients needed to house a spell. As an action, you can instill the magic of one of the spells from your alchemist spell list, listed below, into one of the potions.

Your potions also work differently than a normal spell would in multiple ways; you twist spells to fit your expertise. As a potion, all spells have a range of ‘self’ (unless stated in the spell that the spell only affects you and the range indicates the radius that the spell’s powers emit from you). All spells only affect the creature that drank the potion, even if the spell indicates that it affects multiple creatures and instructs you to choose multiple people.
You do not need any of the material components for the spells on your list. All potions last until the time limit on the spell is reached (you can not choose to end the spell early).
You do not need to make concentration checks for spells cast through potions that you or others have used.
The effect of the potions become inert through spells that would negate magical effects (such as ‘dispel magic’).

Potions become active from the moment you drink them by taking the ‘use object’ action. Only one potion can be active at a time, if another one of your potions becomes active the effects of the last potion become inert and end immediately.

Potions that you create can only be used until you finish a long rest, at which point any crafted potions expire and cannot be used after completing a long rest. At the end of a long rest, you have access to a number potions equal to the number of Alchemist spell slots according to your Alchemist level indicated on the Alchemist potion making table.

To make a potion, you must have an Alchemist spell slot for the appropriate spell level or higher. Your spells gain any improvements from using higher spell slots, if applicable (excluding circumstances that increase how many creatures would be affected by the potion at once).

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your alchemist spells, since you learn your spells and how to make potions through dedicated study, practice and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an Alchemist spell you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Apothecary
entries: At 2nd level, you have learned how to properly use tools that are normal for an alchemist or apothecary to use. You gain proficiency with the alchemist supplies, herbalism kit, and poisoner’s kit, if you are not already proficient with them. Additionally, your familiarity with these tools has allowed you the ability to craft healing potions. You can make Potions of Healing that heal for 1d8 hit points, you can make a number of these per short or long rest equal to your Intelligence modifier. It cost 20 gold per potion made to represent materials used.

subclassFeature.name: Noxious Bombs
entries: At 7th level, you have learned how to add elements to your bombs to cause your opponents even more dismay on the battlefield. Rather than the bludgeoning damage that your bombs normally do, you can choose to have them do either acid or poison damage instead. Additionally, you can convert one of your bombs into a Gas Bomb with the following effects: you throw your bomb to an area within your normal range as an action, the bomb releases a poisonous gas within a 25 feet radius of the spot it landed, the gas lasts 1 minute and any creature that starts its turn in the poisonous gas must make a Constitution saving throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, affected creatures are poisoned for 1 hour. You can not make another gas bomb again using this feature until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potions of Greater Healing
entries: At 11th level, you have learned how to greatly enhance your Potions of Healing; they now heal for 2d8 + your Intelligence modifier hit points. At 18 level, this increases to 4d8 + your Intelligence modifier hit points and you can make your potions without a cost.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Resistance
entries: By 14th level, due to your extended time spent around acids and poisons, your body has built up a resistance to them. You gain resistance to acid and poison damage and have advantage on all saving throws against being poisoned.

subclassFeature.name: Potion Chugger
entries: At 18th level, you have learned how to keep the effects of your last potion active, even while under the effects of a new one. You can have two separate creatures, including yourself, under the effects of your potions, or two potions affecting yourself at the same time. A creature other than yourself can not be under the effects of two of your potions at the same time, and potions become inactive the same manner as before; when you use a new potion while two are active, the oldest potion’s effects become inactive.

subclassFeature.name: Mad Bomber
entries: At 2nd level, you begin to hone your skills as a bomber which allows you to throw your bombs twice the distance, up to 120 feet, that you would normally be able to. You also gain the ability to make an additional number of bombs equal to half of your Specialist level on a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Light the Fuse
entries: At 7th level, you have learned how to truly demolish anything you hit with your bombs. Rather than the bludgeoning damage that your bombs normally do, you can choose to have them do either fire or thunder damage instead. Additionally, you can also convert one of your bombs into a Satchel Charge. You can throw the Satchel Charge to an area within your normal range and you can detonate the Satchel Charge as a bonus action. The Satchel Charge has a 15 feet radius from where you threw it and any creature within the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. Affected targets suffer 4d6 piercing damage and 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half damage on a successful one. Then, affected targets within the radius must then succeed a Strength saving throw or be flung 20 feet in the opposite direction of the Satchel Charge. You can not make another Satchel Charge again using this feature until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Sharp Shrapnel
entries: At 11th level, you have learned how to make your bomb’s shrapnel even deadlier than before. When a creature succeeds the Dexterity saving throw on your bombs' shrapnel piercing damage, they now take half damage.

subclassFeature.name: Conditional Detonation
entries: At 14th level, you can set a condition to detonate your bombs when the chosen condition is met.
You may set your bombs on a timer, preparing a time for your bombs to detonate (no longer than 24 hours).

You may also set your bombs to detonate when a certain amount of pressure is put on them (no less than 20 pounds of pressure and no more 600 pounds of pressure). If these bombs do not detonate within 24 hours, they become inert.

If the bombs you applied conditions to are discovered before they explode, a creature can attempt to disarm them with the DC = 10 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier; they must use either thieves tools or the Mechanics skill. If they fail the check to disarm the bomb, the bomb will detonate and they must then make a Dexterity saving throw, creatures that fail the saving throw take the bomb’s full damage, creatures that succeed take half damage.

subclassFeature.name: Thermite Reaction
entries: At 18th level, as a Demolitionist you have learned how to harness the destructivity of thermite. As an action, you can apply thermite to one creature or object within 5 feet of you. The targeted creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) to determine how thoroughly the target is doused in thermite. When a creature doused in thermite suffers fire damage, they become ignited. When a creature is ignited, they immediately suffer 4d8 fire damage on a failure, and take half as much on a success. The creature then continues to suffer this damage as a new damage roll at the start of the creature’s turn for 1 minute or until the creature uses two consecutive actions to attempt to put out the flames. You can not use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Technological Expert
entries: At 2nd level, you have become quite the savant when it comes to dealing with machines and burgeoning technology. If you are not already proficient in the Mechanics skill, or tinker tools, you gain proficiency with them. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability checks you make with the Mechanics skill and tinker tools.

subclassFeature.name: Dazzler
entries: At 7th level, you have learned how to harness the energy you have been studying and infuse your bombs with it. Rather than the bludgeoning damage that your bombs normally do, you can choose to have them do either lightning or radiant damage instead. Additionally, you can convert one of your bombs to produce a Flare Bomb which the light can blind your enemies. You can throw this bomb the same range as a normal bomb as an action and anyone within 40 feet radius of the flare must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, affected creatures are blinded for 1 minute. You can not make another Flare Bomb again using this feature until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Railgun
entries: At 11th level, your study of electricity has reached a point that you have begun to understand the powers of electromagnetism and have the ability to harness electromagnetism in order to create a railgun. The first time you construct your Railgun, it is a product of long and arduous work which took place over your entire time spent as a Mechanist, if you ever need to construct a replacement railgun, it will take three days worth of downtime and 4000 gold to represent materials used.

The railgun is a ranged weapon with a range of 180/400 which does 5d8 + your Dexterity modifier piercing damage and has the 'Loading' property. If there is an enemy directly behind an enemy you hit with the railgun (up to 20 feet behind the creature you hit) you can make an attack roll against that creature and this attack deals 2d8 + your Dexterity modifier piercing damage. You can use your railgun a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, after which you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Analyst
entries: At 14th level, you have advantage on ability checks made to repair, disable, or discern the properties and abilities of mechanical devices.

subclassFeature.name: Death Ray
entries: At 18th level, your studies and tinkering have culminated into what might be one of the deadliest weapons man has ever created, the Death Ray. The first time you construct your Death Ray it is a product of long and arduous work which took place over your entire time spent as a Mechanist, if you ever need to construct a replacement one it will take one week's worth of downtime and 10,000 gold to represent materials used. As an action, you can fire the Death Ray directly from you in a straight line for 120 feet. Any creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw, affected creatures take 8d12 radiant damage on a failed save, half as much on a successful one. The Death Ray disintegrates, sets fire to, or sears anything within the area that is not being worn. You can not use the Death Ray again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Devil
entries: Deals with the infernal

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Devil lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a Warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Deal with the Devil
entries: At 1st level, the deal with your devil has afforded you some kind of exceptional ability. Choose a skill or tool of your choice that you are not proficient in and you gain proficiency in it, you then also choose a skill or tool (it can be the same skill or tool this feature gave you proficiency in), your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with the skill or tool you have chosen.

subclassFeature.name: Shrewd Minded
entries: At 1st level, the pact with your devil makes it so being charmed by other lesser beings is much harder. You gain advantage on all saving throws made against being charmed.

subclassFeature.name: Light Bearer
entries: At 6th level, the pact you have made with your patron has given you insight into better use of the tools your devil has given you. When you use a spell that does fire or radiant damage you may add your Charisma modifier to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Fiendish Resilience
entries: At 10th level, you can choose one damage type when you finish a short or long rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature. Damage from magical weapons or silvered weapons ignores this resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Hurled Through Hell
entries: At 14th level, when you hit a creature with an attack, you can use this feature to instantly transport the target through the lower planes. The creature disappears and hurtles through a nightmare landscape. At the end of your next turn, the target returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. If the target is not a fiend, it takes 10d10 psychic damage as it reels from its horrific experience. Once you use this feature, you can not use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Eldritch Remnant
entries: Deals with ancient arcanum

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Eldritch Remnant lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a Warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Recharge
entries: At 1st level, your patron’s power overflows within you, allowing you to regain use of your magic without even resting. You regain a Warlock Spell Slot for every 8 - your Charisma modifier hours since you have finished your last short or long rest. If you already have your maximum number of Warlock spell slots you can not regain a spell slot until one has been used.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Aura
entries: At 6th level, the magic that your patron has bestowed upon has begun to seep out and is now creating a magical aura around you. This aura allows you to always perceive magic around you and cut down the magical defenses of those that oppose you. Your Arcane Aura’s range has a 15 feet radius and within that radius, all creatures have disadvantage on 52 CHAPTER 2 | CLASSES saving throws against your Warlock spells. Additionally, you are always under the effects of detect magic within that 15 feet radius. The radius of your aura increases to 30 feet at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Vitality
entries: At 10th level, you have learned to bolster your arcane defenses immensely. As a bonus action, you can gain resistance to all magical damage, but doing so leaves you vulnerable to physical attacks. While you use this feature, you have vulnerability to all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. You can stop the use of this feature as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Discharge
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to create a reactive magical explosion when you are damaged by a spell. Whenever you take magical damage, you can use your reaction to make every creature within 30 feet of you make a Dexterity saving throw against your Warlock spell save DC. On a success, a creature takes damage equal to Warlock level + your Charisma modifier, on a failure they take double that damage. Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you regain use of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: The Loa
entries: Deals with spirits

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Loa lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Loa Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell animate dead}, {@spell speak with the dead}

subclassFeature.name: Luck of the Spirits
entries: At 1st level, you can call on your patron to alter fate in your favor. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or a saving throw, you can use this feature to add 1d10 to your roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll but before any of the roll’s results occur. Once you use this feature, you can not use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Voodoo Doll
entries: At 6th level, you have learned how to imbue a doll with the likeness and essence of another creature. As an action, you can turn your voodoo doll into one that resembles a creature that you can see within 60 feet, a creature you have met and associated with for at least 30 minutes, or a creature you have observed for at least 4 hours. The voodoo doll has hit points equal to 4 times your Warlock level. While you have the voodoo doll, you have advantage on attack rolls made against that creature and advantage Wisdom (Perception) checks involving that creature. The voodoo doll ceases to function if it is farther than 1 mile from the target. You can cast spells and attack the doll as if you were attacking the creature you have targeted and any attack rolls or saving throws for damaging spells the creature would make the doll automatically fail. Non-damaging spells cast on the doll act as if the spell was cast on the creature the doll was the target of. Every time you damage the doll, the creature who it resembles makes a Constitution Saving Throw and on a failure they take full damage done to the doll, on a success they take half the damage done. The doll dissipates when its hit points drop to 0 and any excess damage is not carried over.

subclassFeature.name: Hoodoo, Heals, and Hexes
entries: At 10th level, after you finish a long rest, you can take a short amount of time to construct hoodoo bags that you can expend and utilize for a number of functions. You can construct a number of bags equal to your Charisma modifier. As an action, you can use a hoodoo bag to cast the Nondetection spell without expending a spell slot, you may cast Bestow Curse without expending a spell slot, or you can heal a creature of your choice within touch range for 3d6 plus your Charisma modifier. As a bonus action, you may cast Hex as a 3rd level spell without expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Friends from the Other Side
entries: At 14th level, you have found a way to bring forth some of the friends you have made on the ethereal plane. As a bonus action, you can summon a number of spirits. You have 20 points to select a number of spirits to summon that equal to or less than the number of points you have.

items: Zombies and Skeletons = 1 point
Shadows = 2 points
Specters and Ghouls = 4 points
Will-o’-Wisps and Ghasts = 8 points
Wights = 12 points
Ghosts = 16 points
Wraiths = 20 points

entries: On your turn you can use your action to command the spirits you summon. The spirits last for 10 minutes, or until their hit points drop to 0, after which point they disappear. Once you use this feature, you can not use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Void
entries: Deals with the unknown

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Void lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Bleak Emptiness
entries: At 1st level, you can plunge a creature into an illusory realm.

As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, it is frightened by you for 1 minute or until your concentration is broken (as if you are concentrating on a spell). This effect ends early if the creature takes any damage. Until this illusion ends, the creature thinks it is lost in the dark emptiness of the void which you can detail to your choosing. The creature can see and hear only itself, you, and the illusion. You must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Crushing Aura
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to crush and stun your foes with the aura of the void as an action. When you take this action, each creature within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. This effect also ends if the creature takes damage.

subclassFeature.name: Crushing Force
entries: At 10th level, you have learned how to add the crushing force of the void to your spells. When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for a spell you cast that deals force damage, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Void
entries: At 14th level you gain the ability to transform yourself into a shadow form as a bonus action. In this form, you have resistance to all damage and immunity to force damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 force damage (ignoring any immunity) if you end your turn inside an object. You remain in this form for 1 minute or until your concentration is broken (as if you are concentrating on a spell). You can not use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Brute Strength
entries: At 1st level, your might is already considerable and you can lift and break things that many normal people would not be able to. Your carrying capacity (including maximum load and maximum lift) is doubled, and you have advantage on Strength checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects.

subclassFeature.name: Savage Reaction
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned how to change targets incredibly quickly after dispatching the one you had been focusing on. When you drop an enemy’s hit points to 0, you can use your reaction to immediately move up to your speed towards an enemy and make a melee weapon attack against an enemy within range.

subclassFeature.name: Fierce Grasp
entries: At 9th level, you can wield a two handed weapon in one hand as long as you are not wielding a weapon in your other hand and you can use two weapon fighting even if the weapons you are using do not have the light property.

subclassFeature.name: Unbreakable
entries: At 15th level, you have learned how to brace yourself properly for incoming damage. When you take damage you can instead choose to reduce the amount of damage you take by half. Once you use this feature you can not use it again until you finish a short rest or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Brutality
entries: At 20th level, you can truly start dealing out true brutality to your enemies. You can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack. Additionally once per turn, when you successfully make a melee weapon attack you can choose to maximize your damage roll. Once you use this feature you can not use it again until you finish a short or long rest or until you score a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis at the Ready
entries: At 1st level, you can don and doff your shield as a bonus action, instead of an action.

subclassFeature.name: Vanguard
entries: At 3rd level, you always stand at-the-ready to attack enemies and strike them down when they come too close to you and your allies. Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they use the disengage action and when an enemy moves within your reach you can use your reaction to make an attack against them.

subclassFeature.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: At 9th level, you have learned how to battle on your mount much more effectively. If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. Additionally, if an enemy makes an attack roll against your mount, you can instead use your reaction to make that attack target you (it must still meet or exceed your AC to hit), and if it does hit you can halve the attack's damage.

subclassFeature.name: Survivor
entries: At 15th level, you attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if your hit points are less than or equal to half of your hit point total. You do not gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Defender
entries: At 20th level, you have mastered the art of reacting to everything happening on the battlefield. You can use your reaction during a round even if you have already used a reaction that round, however you may not use more than one reaction per turn. Additionally, if an enemy makes an attack against anyone other than you while they are within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make an attack against them.

subclassFeature.name: Samurai’s Finesse
entries: While using a weapon that you are proficient in you can treat that weapon as if it had the finesse property.

subclassFeature.name: Agile Maneuverability
entries: At 1st level, you are able to move much more efficiently in armor thanks to your training. You can add half of your proficiency score to Dexterity saving throws you make. Additionally, when you wear medium armor, you can add a maximum of 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher. When you are wearing light armor, you have advantage on Acrobatics ability checks.

subclassFeature.name: Step Like the Wind
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned how to move more quickly in combat the less armor you are wearing. While not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you can use the Disengage action as a bonus action, and while not while not wearing heavy armor, medium armor, or using a shield you can use the Dash action as bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: At 9th level, you have learned to harness your almost inhuman reaction speed to stop enemy ranged attacks. When your enemy makes a ranged weapon attack you can use your reaction to prevent an amount of damage that would be done to you by ranged weapon attacks equal to 1d10 + your Wielder level.

subclassFeature.name: Crescent Strike
entries: At 15th level, you can use your weapon to produce an attack that hits enemies even if they are not in melee range. As an action, you can use your melee weapon to slash in front of you dealing damage in a 15 feet cone (20 feet if your weapon has the reach property) and all creatures in that cone must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier, your choice). On a failure, they take 2d10 plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) of slashing damage, half as much on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Steel
entries: At 20th level, you have come to understand your weapon so well you can feel its spirit. Any weapons on your person can not be broken by non-magical means, and all weapon attacks you make with weapons you are proficient with count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks and damage. You can now also draw out your weapon’s spirit to aid you in combat. When you call out your weapon’s spirit, for the next 1 minute when you make a successful attack with your weapon, instead of rolling the weapon’s damage, you instead inflict the maximum amount of damage the weapon can do. You regain this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Domain
entries: Bringer of battle

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons, heavy armor, and unarmed strikes. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage. Your unarmed strike damage increases to 1d6 at 5th level and again to 1d8 at 11th level.

subclassFeature.name: Communion of Combat
entries: At 1st level, your god gives you the distinct honor of being able to use your divine spells while in martial combat. You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands and you can use your weapon or shield as if it was a spell focus.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Declaration of War
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to empower combat abilities in nearly every way. As a bonus action, you can use your channel divinity to make all your weapon attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming immunity and resistances for 1 minute. Additionally, you can add your Charisma modifier to damage rolls and AC for the duration of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Guided Hand
entries: At 6th level, when you, or a creature within 60 feet you, makes an attack roll that would miss, you can choose to reroll the attack, but must use the new roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You must finish a long rest before you regain all uses of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Constant Vigilance
entries: At 8th level, your divine abilities help you to strike foes when they first come within your range and allows you to cut off their retreats. When a creature first moves within range for you and makes an attack roll with a melee weapon, you can use your reaction to make an attack roll against that creature. Additionally, creatures within 5 feet of you provoke opportunity attacks from you, even if they take the Disengage action before leaving your reach.

subclassFeature.name: Complete Conquest
entries: At 17th level, you regain a use of your Channel Divinity whenever you drop a creature’s hit points to 0.

subclassFeature.name: Life Domain
entries: Bringer of health

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of Life
entries: At 1st level, your healing spells are more effective. Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Preserve Life
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to heal the badly injured. As an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your Zealot level. Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can not use this feature on an undead or a construct.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Healer
entries: At 6th level, the healing spells you cast on others heal you as well. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature other than you, you regain hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Warding
entries: At 8th level, holy magic lies so heavily upon you that it forms a divine ward against enemy magic. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to damage from spells. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Healing
entries: At 17th level, when you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell, you instead use the highest number possible for each die. For example, instead of restoring 2d6 hit points to a creature, you restore 12.

subclassFeature.name: Radiance Domain
entries: Bringer of light

entries.caption: Radiance Domain Spells
rows: {@spell guardian of faith}, {@spell wall of fire}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the Light cantrip if you do not already know it.

subclassFeature.name: Blinding Light
entries: At 1st level, you can briefly blind enemies with your holy flames. When you cast a Zealot spell of 1st level or higher that deals either fire or radiant damage, you can have a creature damaged by that spell make a Constitution saving throw. The DC is equal to your Spell Save DC. On a failure, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and perception checks that involve sight until the end of their next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You must finish a long rest before you regain all uses of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Like a Flash
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to move as fast as the light that you embody. On your turn, you can use your channel divinity to perform an action using your bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Luminous Splendor
entries: At 6th level, you can feel your lustrous strength blossom within you in such a way that your radiance will never dull. When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die on attacks that deal radiant or fire damage, you can reroll the die. You must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

subclassFeature.name: Shining Smite
entries: At 8th level, you are so infused with incandescent energy from your god that all your melee weapon strikes carry divine power with them. Whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon, the creature takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage. lf you also use your Divine Smite with an attack, you add this damage to the extra damage of your Divine Smite.

subclassFeature.name: Guiding Light
entries: At 17th level, you can use your action to summon a pillar of light that extends out in a 5 feet radius and is 10 feet tall. This pillar sheds bright light in a 120 feet radius and dim light for another 120 feet after that. Allies that are within the radius of the dim light can add your Charisma modifier to their attack rolls. Allies within the radius of the bright light gain this effect, and can also add your Charisma modifier to their damage rolls as radiant damage. Allies within the pillar gain both effects and are also immune to radiant and fire damage while within the pillar. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Sky Domain
entries: Bringer of tempests

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Might of the Stormbringer
entries: At 1st level, when you make a successful spell attack against a creature or a creature fails its saving throw against one of your Zealot spells and that spell does cold, lightning, or thunder damage you can force that creature to make a Strength saving throw versus your Zealot spell save DC. On a failure the target is knocked down and becomes prone and you can make a weapon attack as a reaction against the creature you knocked prone if they are within range, on a success this feature fails. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and you regain all uses of this feature on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Destructive Wrath
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to wield the power of the sky and storm with unchecked ferocity. When you roll lightning or thunder damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling damage.

subclassFeature.name: Discharge
entries: At 6th level, when you deal lightning damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can also push it up to 10 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Charged Smite
entries: At 8th level, you have learned how to charge your divine smite with the power of lightning itself. When you use the divine smite feature, you add an additional 1d8 lightning damage to the damage roll. At 14th level, this becomes 2d8 lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Servant of the Sky
entries: At 17th level, you gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage and you gain the ability to sprout a pair of angel wings from your back, gaining a flying speed equal to your current speed. You can create these wings as a bonus action on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as a bonus action on your turn. You can not manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

item.name: Leather Pads
entries: Leather Pads consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

item.name: Duster
entries: Duster consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

item.name: Padded Duster
entries: Made from tough but flexible leather, padded duster is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

item.name: Hide Armor
entries: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

item.name: Lightweight Padded Vest
entries: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

item.name: Crude Padded Vest
entries: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

item.name: Padded Vest
entries: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

item.name: Heavy Padded Vest
entries: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

item.name: Chained Mail
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

item.name: Ballistic Mail
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

item.name: Splint Armor
entries: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

item.name: Plate Armor
entries: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

item.name: Wooden Shield
entries: A shield is made from wood and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 1. You can benefit from only one shield at a time. (can be equipped as a bonus action)

item.name: Metal Shield
entries: A shield is made from metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

entries.name: Special
entries: The bayonet can be attached to any firearm with the two handed property, and while attached, the firearm can function as a simple melee weapon that deals 1d6 piercing damage and has the reach property.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon must be reloaded with an action; it requires 2 people to operate.

entries.name: Special
entries: Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks made to conceal Derringers are made with advantage. If the user already has advantage on the roll, add +5 to the roll total.

entries.name: Special
entries: 1 attack with this weapon consumes 2 ammo.

entries.name: Special
entries: 1 attack with this weapon consumes 10 ammo, requires 3 people to operate.

entries.name: Special
entries: 1 attack with this weapon consumes 2 ammo.

entries.name: Special
entries: As an action you can light the fuse of the dynamite. Any creature within 5 feet of the dynamite when it detonates (at the end of your turn) must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be damaged by the dynamite, creatures take half as much damage on a successful save.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Afflicted live to roughly half of the life expectancy of the race in which their family is descended from.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Afflicted are not predisposed to any particular alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: An Afflicted's size is determined by the race in which their family is descended from.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Irradiated
