entries: You are immune to any environmental damage or effects which are caused by toxic, irradiated, or poisonous atmospheres. This does not include spells and magical effects which involve poison.

entries.name: Radioactive Resistance
entries: You are resistant to radiant damage.

entries.name: Dense Skin
entries: While not wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

entries.name: Diverse Ancestry
entries: As an Afflicted, your family is descended from another race of people which has been afflicted by the toxic atmosphere. As such, you may choose one racial feature from the race of which you are descended from. This excludes ability score increases.

entries.name: Mutation
entries: Your parents' exposure to the toxic environment has caused a genetic mutation in you. You can add +1 to an ability score of your choosing, excluding Constitution.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Your parents' exposure to the toxic environment has caused a genetic mutation in you. You can add +1 to an ability score of your choosing, excluding Constitution.

The Afflicted are a group of people who are descendants of a society which suffered a terrible fate. Their homelands were ruptured by fissures which exposed a leyline of toxic primordial energy. Many members of this society simply died as a result of the toxic radiation, but a select few were able to survive. Most survivors moved on, but some decided to stay within the toxic region. They reasoned that living within the boundaries of the toxicity would protect them from foreign invasion and colonization. Over centuries, their bodies adapted to the radiation and now they thrive in societies which have been isolated from the world at large, living lives free of war and foreign politics.

entries.name: Seasoned Bodies
entries: The appearance and physical proportions of an Afflicted are largely reliant on their ancestry. The Afflicted are not a race of people as much as they are a group of peoples which suffer from the same syndrome. As such, all Afflicted have leathery, dense skin. For them, growing hair is difficult, often impossible. Instead, they sometimes participate in a practice known as decorative branding, in which they seer their weathered skin into decorative patterns, similar to tattooing.

entries.name: Living Beyond Toxicity
entries: Afflicted who move away from the toxic regions their people call home often struggle with the complexities of societal and geographical politics. Most are entirely naive to societies which are composed of people from diverse backgrounds. From the opposite perspective, most people are entirely unfamiliar with societies and people which come from these radioactive regions.

entries.name: Afflicted Names
entries: The Afflicted follow normal naming traditions shared by most other intelligent humanoid races.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: The life expectancy of an Anomlian is largely unknown. This is because they can only live independently in the Void, which has a tendency create and destroy spontaneously. In a vacuum, Anomlians live less than 10 years. However, assuming hosts increases the lifespan of Anomlians tenfold.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The unpredictable nature of the Void often leads Anomlians to have a chaotic alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Anomlians assume the size of their host creatures.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is the same as the host, 30 feet if the host is Medium, 25 if they are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Hosting
entries: As an Anomlian, you assume the mind and body of an intelligent humanoid. If your host's body were to die, you would be forced out of their body, as their post-mortem neurochemicals would begin to spread to your being. If you were not to find another host within an hour, or half an hour in extreme conditions, you would also die. In order to assimilate a new host, you must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma skill check. You can only attempt to assimilate to any single individual once. While not currently attached to a host, your Hit Point total is equal to your total number of class levels. If you are reduced to 0 Hit Points you do not make death saving throws, you die. While without a host, you can not speak or conduct any actions beside attempting to assimilate a new host.

entries.name: Void Sense
entries: You can sense any creature that also has Void Sense within 60 feet of you and you know the location of that creature. You can also communicate telepathically with them even if they are incapable of speech normally.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Subraces
entries: Anomlians gain certain advantages based on the region of the brain in which their core inhabits: Basis in the Frontal Lobe, Basis in the Occipital Lobe, and Basis in the Sensory Motor Cortex.

Anomlians are parasitic creatures from a dimension known simply as 'the Void.' In their truest form they are gelatinous purple and black blobs. But they are rarely in this form as they leech from other organisms for sustenance. When Anomlians find a host, they enter their being and override their nervous system, assuming complete control over their mind and body through charismatic force. How these beings escaped to the material plane is unknown. They have no true purpose other than to survive.

entries.name: Of The Void
entries: The Void is a dimension of pure chaos. Matter is in a constant state of being created and destroyed. It is a desolate landscape of darkness with the geography consisting of blacks and purples. Mountains and hills flow like oceans, gravity is in a constant state of changing direction and intensity, and miniature black holes form randomly across its boundaries. Even the fiercest creatures struggle to survive.

entries.name: Playing Host
entries: In the material plane, Anomlians prefer to host intelligent humanoids, though that is not always the case. Beyond the Void, Anomlians can only survive for about an hour outside of the atmosphere of a host, lest they dry up and die. Once they find a host, they can not leave them until the host dies due to the way in which they overlap their host's brain.

Anomlians assimilate their host's knowledge with their own, building a library of resources not only of their host's world, but also of the host's previous life. Anomlians are likely to abandon the social life of a fresh host in pursuit of their own goals, but sometimes they continue their host's life as if nothing happened.

entries.name: Anomlian Names
entries: Anomlians are inherently nameless, being born through random surges of energy and creation in the Void. In the material plane, Anomlians will often adopt the original name of their host, or make a new one.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Cactoids begin their life as sprouts, having basic sentience but no limbs with which to walk or move. Cactoids are considered adults when they have fully developed their arms and legs, which happens approximately 2 years after their seed sprouted. Cactoids can live up to 180-200 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Cactoids are not predisposed to any particular alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Cactoids are between 4 and 8 feet tall and can be anywhere from 100-350 pounds depending on size and shape. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Cactoid.

entries.name: Heat Resistant
entries: You have resistance to Fire damage.

entries.name: Regenerative Body
entries: You have the ability to regenerate limbs and organs, barring that your missing organs are not fatal. For something small, like a finger, the regeneration would only take about 3 days. For something larger, like a foot, the regeneration would take about 7 days. For something big, like a leg, the regeneration would take about 14 days. The body parts reform slowly but do not function properly until the regeneration process is fully completed.

entries.name: Desert Dweller & Rooting
entries: Cactoids are omnivorous creatures that require food and water, like any other humanoid. However, Cactoids only require 1 pint (1/2 liter) of water per week. Cactoids also only require half of the food an average humanoid does.

Additionally, you can choose to root yourself during a long rest if you are resting in a terrain with nutrient-rich soil, such as Coast, Desert, Forest, Grassland, and Mountains. Rooting yourself over the course of a long rest satisfies your eating requirements for the next 3 days. While rooted your movement speed is reduced to 0. Unrooting for an amount of time during your long rest which would require you to restart your rest would also cause this feature to reset.

entries.name: Prickly Hide
entries: When you are damaged by an unarmed attack or when you successfully hit with an unarmed attack, you can inflict an additional 1d4 piercing damage to your opponent due to the spines that cover your skin. However, the spines on your skin are limited, you can use this ability 10 times after which you must take a long rest before you can use this feature again.

Cactoids are sentient cactus-people. The exact origins of these people is unknown but it is highly suggested that they are influenced by the same primordial magic which drives Elementals. Unlike Elementals, Cactoids possess more agency and are capable of cohabitating with other intelligent life. They are largely desert dwellers and possess superior survivability in those climates.

entries.name: Biology and Appearance
entries: Cactoids are diverse and variable in their shape and size.

They may be short and round, tall and slender, tall and round, short and slender, or anywhere in between. Their skin is usually a variety of green and they may have flowers of many varieties which sprout from their head. Their prickly spines are not skinny and numerous. Rather, Cactoids have large but stout spines which, like any other weapon, are only harmful when purposefully used that way. The spines are only about as wide as a whiskey glass and protrude to only about an inch; they are also relatively sparse with the average Cactoid having only about a dozen spines on each section of their body.

Cactoids reproduce through pollination enacted by insects, birds, and bats. As such, Cactoids have no biological sex or gender. Because of this, Cactoids often choose a gender identification that most fits with their personality in order to relate themselves to the norms of other intelligent humanoids.

entries.name: An Individual Lifestyle
entries: Unlike other humanoids, who largely rely on communities and social structures in order to survive, Cactoids are capable of living an entirely solitary lifestyle if they chose to.

They need not depend on agriculture or currency should they choose not to, they can provide for all of their needs independently. However, this type of lifestyle would be similar to a hermit's who survives on bread and water. Some Cactoids still retain the need for social interaction with intelligent creatures. As such, Cactoids flock to civilization, not for any survival needs, but for social needs.

entries.name: Cactoid Names
entries: Due to their reproductive methods, Cactoids and Cactoid names are not gendered.

items: Names: Austro, Caly, Hue, Kio, Mai, Opun, Peres, Poe, hip, Rowni, Tio

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Like their Couatl ancestors, Couatlborn are slow to mature. It takes the average Couatlborn about 30 years to reach full maturity. Because they are only about 2 feet long when they are hatched, they must spend decades shedding their skin in order to reach their full height. Couatlborn experience puberty around their mid-20's, during which they experience a growth spurt which brings them from 3-5 feet tall to 6-8 feet tall. Couatlborn can live up to 300 years and are not considered elderly until their final few decades.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The moral alignment of a Couatlborn is largely determined by their upbringing. Those who serve benevolent Couatl are often good. Those who serve malevolent ones, evil. Those who are removed from their clan often shift their alignment to one that opposes their Couatl demi-god. Regardless, Couatlborn are almost always lawful, being institutionally raised to be strict believers in rules and laws.

entries.name: Size
entries: Couatlborn are between 6 and 8 feet tall and average about 200 pounds. Your size is Medium. Couatlborn younger than 20 years old range between 3 and 5 feet tall and are considered Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan. As a method of acknowledging their fey ancestry, Couatlborn often teach their children Sylvan. Couatlborn are often driven by their connection to the fey.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can not discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: Your Couatl ancestry has granted your bloodline a faint magical essence. As such, once per long rest you can cast one of the following spells 'at will': Detect Good and Evil, Detect Magic, Thaumaturgy.

entries.name: Inherent Shapeshifter
entries: Couatl are known for their notorious ability to shapeshift, their Couatlborn descendants also receive a rudimentary ability to change their shape. Once per long rest, you may shapeshift which follows the same boundaries as the Disguise Self spell. However, your shapeshifting can only affect yourself, not any items, clothing, or equipment you are carrying. But the way in which you shapeshift is not illusory. For example, if you were to shapeshift into a human with long hair, the hair would be real and tangible, even if you do not have any hair in your true form.

entries.name: Subraces
entries: Couatlborn are separated into two categories based on the dominant traits of which they inherited from their Couatl ancestors: Inheritors of Might and Inheritors of Mind.

Couatlborn are snake-like humanoids which were crafted, rather than emerging as a product of evolution. They have scaled skin which is usually composed of some combination of white, green, orange, and pink. They have short reptilian faces and serpent-like tails. Couatlborn are sometimes capable of growing feathers along their head and arms which can be styled. They have four-fingered hands (including thumbs) with small claw-like fingertips and pawed, dinosaurlike feet. Couatlborn reproduce through egg-laying, like snakes and birds.

entries.name: Derivatively Crafted
entries: The Couatlborn are a race of people which were created by ancient Couatl as servants, or slaves. Couatl originally used early human worshipers, who believed them to be gods, as servants. But as humans evolved from living in caves, they began to doubt the divinity of these giant serpents. As such, humans moved beyond the lands in which these Couatl inhabited and formed their own religions. The Couatl were left without followers to serve them. Eventually, they grew desperate enough to start experimenting with their own eggs. Through the innate arcane adaptivity granted by their celestial ancestry, the Couatl manipulated their eggs into producing smaller, more human-like, versions of themselves. After more experimenting, the Couatl were able to produce these Couatlborn in such a way that they were able to reproduce themselves and no longer had to be birthed from the Couatl's own eggs.

entries.name: A Strong Sense of Clan
entries: Like most divine, or at least demi-divine, creatures, Couatl source their power from the devotion and faith of their followers. As such, Couatl have institutionally created a sense of community and one-ness within their congregation. To Couatlborn, being a worshiper of your patron Couatl and serving them is your life's work. Service of your god is the sacrifice which will guarantee the ascendance of your soul. To denounce your clan is to denounce god. Your clan is your family and you are all united under your Couatl god.

entries.name: Beyond a Life of Service
entries: Some Couatlborn are able to escape the cult of their patron Couatl god. This apostasy is no easy feat as it often involves the complete abandonment of their entire lives, every single family member they have ever had. Sometimes those who escape these cults have a hard time adjusting to life outside of it, having to remind themselves that they do not have to save their money in order to make an offering, or that most people's families are not composed of hundreds of individuals.

entries.name: Couatlborn Names
entries: Couatlborn's first names are derived from names given to their ancestors, who were originally created to serve Couatl demi-gods. Their surnames are often simply the name of whatever ancient Couatl demi-god their family once served.

items: Androgynous Names: Ka'lix, Ikli, Ip'tal, Otl, Tepu
Female Names: Cit'ma, Mi'zel, Nen'l, Pipna, Talli
Male Names: Akan, Etzli, Ix'lan, Ma'lum, Paxlon
Surnames: Aax, Apchua, Choek, Gamil, Inkna, Kruum, Okan, Vinntab, Zimli

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Rougaru reach adulthood at around age 14 and can live up to 65-75 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Rougaru are instinctively loyal people, as such they are predisposed to Lawful alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Rougaru are between 6 and 8 feet tall and average about 260 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 35 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Rugarais.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can not discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency with the Athletics skill.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) skill checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Beastly Endurance
entries: Rougaru's bodies are naturally accumulated to demanding physical conditions. When you accumulate levels of exhaustion, you are affected as if you have 1 level of exhaustion lower than what you currently have (including 1 level of exhaustion).

entries.name: Spirit of Fury
entries: Rougaru have a well of instinctual fury which to draw from. When you suffer damage which drops your current hit points to less than half of your maximum hit point, you may use your reaction to activate this feature.

When you activate this feature you temporarily add 4 to your Strength score (your Strength score can not exceed 30 using this feature). This effect lasts for 1 minute. Until this feature ends, at the start of each of your turns you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 10 + your Strength modifier). On a failed save you attack the nearest creature to you. If there are multiple creatures within the same distance of you then your target is decided randomly.

The Rougaru are a race of wolf-people deceptively akin to Werewolves. Rougaru and Werewolves are only related in appearance, they share no biological or zoological relationship. Rougaru are born inherently wolf-people. Unlike Werewolves, who are magically created from other humanoids through a process of lycanthropy, Rougarus’ wolfforms are their true forms. They are born that way, they live that way, and they die that way. They are not quelled by silver, stakes, or divine magics, as they are not lycanthropic. Rougaru often live in packs in their own isolationist societies.

entries.name: Lycanthropic Mimicry
entries: Until relatively recently, the general population thought of Werewolves and Rougaru as the same creatures. As such, Rougaru have unwillingly developed a reputation for being primal, dangerous people, capable of becoming feral at a moment's notice. Rougaru are banned from entering some towns and cities and often their rights to citizenship are questioned.

entries.name: Burdened
entries: After the distinction between Rougaru and Werewolves became more well-known, Rougarus’ value as laborers began to be recognized by those who formally exiled them. Now, people often exploit Rougarus’ societal standings for their own benefits. Morally-bankrupt employers began to hire Rougaru for drastically unfair wages, as well as other forms of exploitative labor practices.

entries.name: Rougaru Names
entries: Current Rougaru naming conventions are based on a combination of Rougaru tradition, which is based on their flowy yet guttural native tongue, and Common names.

items: Androgynous Names: Alex, Baptise, Edmee, Gwen, Jean, Leslie, Rudy
Female Names: Ariane, Cecile, Flavie, Jacquine, Lila, Louisiane, Prisca, Sabrina, Vanica, Yoann
Male Names: Abel, Denis, Fabien, Leonard, Marceau, Patrice, Roch, Roland, Simeon

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Strength score increases by 2 and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Sasquatches reach adulthood around 22 years old and can live up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Sasquatches are not predisposed towards any particular alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sasquatches grow to be between 7 and 8 feet tall and average 300 to 380 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language.

entries.name: Homeland
entries: You gain +2 to any Dexterity (Stealth) or Wisdom (Survival) skill checks in Mountain or Forest terrains (you can choose only one skill and terrain combination).

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) skill checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Big and Burly
entries: You possess natural strength, if you are not already proficient, you gain proficiency in Strength saving throws and the Strength (Athletics) ability skill.

entries.name: Ally of Nature
entries: If you are not already proficient in the Animal Handling skill, you gain proficiency. When performing a Wisdom (Animal Handling) skill check on a Beast-type creature, you may double your proficiency bonus.

The Sasquatch are a race of people native to forested and mountainous regions. They are tall and hairy creatures that appear to be a sort of human-ape hybrid. Only their face, hands, and feet are hairless.The color of their hair can manifest in a variety of shades. They are most often black, brown, ginger, blond, grey, or white.

entries.name: Solitary Lifestyle
entries: Most Sasquatches live alone, away from any other kind of intelligent life. They prefer to be amongst the wildlife native to their homeland. Sasquatches often make companions of wolves, deer, bears, eagles, hawks, badgers, and squirrels.
They eat omnivorously but generally prefer to eat vegetation when available.

Because of their lonely and mysterious existence, locals are often fearful of Sasquatches as they do not know much about them. This does not bother Sasquatches, as they do not quite care for other people, or what they think.

entries.name: A Rarity, of Sorts
entries: Because of their solitary lifestyles, Sasquatches often have difficulty finding compatible mates. As such, the population of Sasquatches is drastically low. Compared to other intelligent humanoid races, the Sasquatch's drive for reproduction is outstandingly low in their hierarchical needs. They seem to have very little evolutionary motivation to find romantic partners or have children.

entries.name: Sasquatch Names
entries: Sasquatch names are often limited to one syllable and they usually do not use surnames

items: Androgynous Names: Ach, Bek, Clem, Doone, Erl, Gem, Lea, Pip
Female Names: Ane, Bel, Broo, Deen, Fait, Greer, Jad, Jo, Keit, Loo, Rute, Vie
Male Names: Arr, Bo, Brant, Cale, Chet, Heit, Kem, Kip, Rog, Som, Tad, Weht

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Sayre can live to be up to 60 years old, however most start to experience the consequences of old age in their 40's. Sayre reach adulthood at around 12 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Sayre are not predisposed to any particular alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sayre are between 5 and 7 feet tall and average about 200 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 35 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sayre.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 20 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can not discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Resilient Lenses
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded or having your eyesight impaired.

entries.name: Water Retentive
entries: You only require about a liter of drinking water every seven days in order to survive.

entries.name: Desert Traverser
entries: You ignore the effects of difficult terrain in heat or desert related obstacles. Additionally, you ignore points of exhaustion caused by exposure to heat or desert related environments.

entries.name: Regenerative Heat
entries: When taking a short rest in a warm environment, you may roll one additional hit die.
The Sayre are native to hot desert climates. They have specific attributes which protect them from environmental effects that would otherwise hinder other desert travelers.

They require relatively little water, have protective eye lenses, and thrive in hot climates. They resemble humans, though their skin is rough and they sport horns which emerge from their foreheads. These horns come to a straight point, but the tips are flat as if they had been sanded. Additionally, Sayre have tails which are reptilian in shape, wide at the base and coming to a thin tip. Until recently, other people have only seen Sayre during deft journeys across the desert and usually made conscious efforts to avoid them. The relative mystery of the Sayre led them to unwillingly adopt the reputation of being 'Desert Devils.' Though they have become more integrated into other societies, the stereotype still exists.

entries.name: Primal Ancestry
entries: Sayre arose from the arcane development of early humans. At the time, magic was dangerous and largely unknown to the primal humans. However, some braver souls chose to experiment with naturalistic methods of harnessing and utilizing the untamed energy. As a result, many were killed. Very few were able to successfully learn the very primitive form of naturalistic spellcasting and even their safety was not guaranteed. The Sayre are rumored to have been born from an early human's botching of a powerful transmutation spell. The spell is rumored to have gotten too powerful for the human to control and it erupted and an arcane explosion which enveloped the mage along with anything within a quarter-mile of them. The explosion left a crater and in the crater was a variety of mutilated and transmuted beings. Birds had grown gills and scales, trees now had wings for leaves, and the mage along with the large reptiles which roamed the primal countryside were now Sayre.

entries.name: Lifelong Limitations
entries: Sayres have a relatively short lifespan when compared to other intelligent humanoid races. Due to the nature of their creation and the environmental factors which challenged early Sayres, they live relatively short lives in the current era. However, Sayres have adapted to this socially, placing more importance on the impact of actions taken which will live beyond a Sayre's life over smaller short-term goals.

entries.name: Sayre Names
entries: Due to their short lifespans and their emphasis on living beyond their own lives, Sayre use their familial surnames as their primary identifier in social situations outside of their family.

items: Sayre Names: Amda, Bach, Faahim, Gael, Ichbee, Laella, Obrey, Quenti, Uumeka
Sayre Surnames: Atamati, Codik, Daffodil, Kadhir, Ladiona, Nadrine, Radbrue, Walden

entries.name: Basis in the Frontal Lobe
entries: The Frontal Lobe is the region of the brain responsible for logic, reasoning, and personality

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1.

entries.name: Personality Overlap
entries: You are able to perfectly mimic the personality, speech, and thought process of the individual which is hosting you.

entries.name: Divergent Thinking
entries: When performing a skill check which uses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you are able to make two checks simultaneously. For example, if you are attempting to persuade an individual to follow you down an alley, you may make a Charisma (Persuasion) check to convince them and a Wisdom (Insight) check to see how anxious they are simultaneously. These skill checks consume the same amount of time as a single skill check normally would.

entries.name: Basis in the Occipital Lobe
entries: The Occipital Lobe is the region of the brain responsible for vision and perception.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Keen Vision
entries: You have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks reliant on sight.

entries.name: Visual Overhaul
entries: You are immune to being blinded by nonmagical effects.

subrace.name: Basis in the Sensory Motor Cortex

entries.name: Basis in the Sensory Motor Cortex
entries: The Sensory Motor Cortex is the region of the brain responsible for the motor controls of the body.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Aerobic Efficiency
entries: Your base movement speed becomes 40 feet.

entries.name: Mind Over Matter
entries: You can ignore the effects of having 1 level of Exhaustion, though you still accumulate Exhaustion levels normally.

entries.name: Inheritor of Might
entries: Inheritors of Might benefit from receiving a portion of the fortitude of their Couatl ancestry

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1.

entries.name: Nocere Tail
entries: You may use your tail as an unarmed weapon attack. You are proficient in this attack and use your Strength modifier. Your tail attack deals 1d4 + your Strength modifier damage. Alternatively, you may use your tail for the purposes of Grappling a target.

entries.name: Arcane-Resistant Scales
entries: Once per long rest, if you fail a saving throw against a magical effect, you may choose to reroll. You must use the new roll.

entries.name: Inheritor of Mind
entries: Inheritors of Mind benefit from receiving a portion of the mental potency of their Couatl ancestry.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1.

entries.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You inherit a form of limited telepathy, which is much more powerful for your Couatl ancestors as it is their primary method of communication. You may telepathically communicate words, sounds, and images to any creature that you can touch. You must be touching the target in order to communicate and the target cannot respond.

entries.name: Shielded Mind
entries: Your mind has been shaped from a creature that is immune to magical prying. You have advantage on any saving throws related to magical effects that attempt to sense your emotions, read your thoughts, or detect your location.
